hints.content:
We need to count how many pictures are above lettuce on the picture graph.

[[☃ image 1]]

There are $\purpleD3$ pictures above lettuce.

$\purpleD3\times\blueD5 = \purpleD{15}$

There are $\purpleD{15}$ ladybugs on the lettuce plant.

options.alt: A picture graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Kind of plant and the vertical axis labeled Number of ladybugs. Each plant kind is listed along the horizontal axis from the left of the axis to the right of the axis as follows: roses, lettuce, alfalfa, and grape vines. The number of ladybugs for each plant kind is represented by the number of ladybug pictures plotted on the graph. Roses are represented by 7 ladybug pictures, lettuce is represented by 3 ladybug pictures, alfalfa is represented by 5 ladybug pictures, and grape vines are represented by 2 ladybug pictures. The ladybug pictures for lettuce are labeled 1, 2, and 3. !

hints.content:
Now we can find how many ladybugs were on each plant. 

[[☃ image 1]]

Kind of plant | Number of [[☃ image 2]] | Number of ladybugs
:- | :-: | :-
$\goldE{\text{Roses}}$ | $7$ | $7\times\blueD{5} =\goldE{35}$
$\purpleD{\text{Lettuce}}$ | $3$ | $3\times\blueD{5} =\purpleD{15}$
$\greenD{\text{Alfalfa}}$ | $5$ | $5\times\blueD{5} =\greenD{25}$
$\maroonD{\text{Grape vines}}$ | $2$ | $2\times\blueD{5} =\maroonD{10}$

options.alt: A picture graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Kind of plant and the vertical axis labeled Number of ladybugs. Each plant kind is listed along the horizontal axis from the left of the axis to the right of the axis as follows: roses, lettuce, alfalfa, and grape vines. The number of ladybugs for each plant kind is represented by the number of ladybug pictures plotted on the graph. Roses are represented by 7 ladybug pictures, lettuce is represented by 3 ladybug pictures, alfalfa is represented by 5 ladybug pictures, and grape vines are represented by 2 ladybug pictures. The ladybug pictures for roses are labeled 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 and 7. The ladybug pictures for lettuce are labeled 1, 2, and 3. The ladybug pictures for alfalfa are labeled 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5. The ladybug pictures for grape vines are labeled 1 and 2. !

hints.content:
Before some of the ladybugs move, there are $\purpleD{15}$ ladybugs on the lettuce.  Then $\maroonD{10}$ ladybugs fly *off of* the lettuce.

$\purpleD{15} - \maroonD{10} = {5}$ ladybugs

After that, there are ${5}$ ladybugs left on the lettuce.  Do any other plants have ${5}$ ladybugs on them?

Before some of the ladybugs move, there are $\greenD{25}$ ladybugs on the alfalfa.  Then $\purpleD{10}$ ladybugs fly *onto* the alfalfa.

$\greenD{25} + \purpleD{10} = \redD{35}$ ladybugs

After that, there are $\redD{35}$ ladybugs on the alfalfa.  Do any other plants have $\redD{35}$ ladybugs on them?
The roses have $\redD{35}$ ladybugs on them.
After the ladybugs fly, the *roses* and *alfalfa* will have the same number of ladybugs on them.

question.content:
Olivia counted the number of ladybugs on each plant in her garden, then made the graph below.


[[☃ image 1]]

[[☃ image 2]]

**If $10$ ladybugs fly from the lettuce to the alfalfa, which $2$ kinds of plants will have the same number of ladybugs?** 

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A picture graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Kind of plant and the vertical axis labeled Number of ladybugs. Each plant kind is listed along the horizontal axis from the left of the axis to the right of the axis as follows: roses, lettuce, alfalfa, and grape vines. The number of ladybugs for each plant kind is represented by the number of ladybug pictures plotted on the graph. Roses are represented by 7 ladybug pictures, lettuce is represented by 3 ladybug pictures, alfalfa is represented by 5 ladybug pictures, and grape vines are represented by 2 ladybug pictures. !
